ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.description:
Use any Linux distribution inside your terminal.
Enable both backward and forward compatibility with software and freedom to use whatever distribution you’re more comfortable with.
Distrobox uses `podman`, `docker` or [`lilipod`](https://github.com/89luca89/lilipod) to create containers using the Linux distribution of your choice.
The created container will be tightly integrated with the host, allowing sharing of the HOME directory of the user, external storage, external USB devices and graphical apps (X11/Wayland), and audio.
about.summary: Use any linux distribution inside your terminal.

name: distrobox

about.description:
Use any Linux distribution inside your terminal.
Enable both backward and forward compatibility with software and freedom to use whatever distribution you’re more comfortable with.
Distrobox uses `podman`, `docker` or [`lilipod`](https://github.com/89luca89/lilipod) to create containers using the Linux distribution of your choice.
The created container will be tightly integrated with the host, allowing sharing of the HOME directory of the user, external storage, external USB devices and graphical apps (X11/Wayland), and audio.
about.summary: Use any linux distribution inside your terminal.

raw_meta_yaml:
context:
  version: "1.8.2.2"

package:
  name: distrobox
  version: ${{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/89luca89/distrobox/archive/refs/tags/${{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 0c797689c0b8c7c7c9fa53d1f5550657af95e64d8b8bbdc0fe374f341ebf6cd0

build:
  number: 0
  script: |
    ./install --prefix "${PREFIX}"

requirements:
  run: __linux

tests:
  - script:
    - distrobox --version
    - distrobox --help
    - distrobox-create --dry-run

about:
  homepage: https://distrobox.it
  summary: 'Use any linux distribution inside your terminal.'
  description: |
    Use any Linux distribution inside your terminal.
    Enable both backward and forward compatibility with software and freedom to use whatever distribution you’re more comfortable with.
    Distrobox uses `podman`, `docker` or [`lilipod`](https://github.com/89luca89/lilipod) to create containers using the Linux distribution of your choice.
    The created container will be tightly integrated with the host, allowing sharing of the HOME directory of the user, external storage, external USB devices and graphical apps (X11/Wayland), and audio.
  license: GPL-3.0-only
  license_file: COPYING.md
  documentation: https://distrobox.it
  repository: https://github.com/89luca89/distrobox

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - eunos-1128

about.description:
Use any Linux distribution inside your terminal.
Enable both backward and forward compatibility with software and freedom to use whatever distribution you’re more comfortable with.
Distrobox uses `podman`, `docker` or [`lilipod`](https://github.com/89luca89/lilipod) to create containers using the Linux distribution of your choice.
The created container will be tightly integrated with the host, allowing sharing of the HOME directory of the user, external storage, external USB devices and graphical apps (X11/Wayland), and audio.
about.summary: Use any linux distribution inside your terminal.
